channel.title: ScrollVault - MTG News & Strategy
channel.description: The latest Magic: The Gathering news, strategy guides, deck techs, set reviews, and spoilers.

item.title: Wizards Kills MTGO Data Transparency With Brainstorm-Style Restriction
item.description: Wizards just eliminated MTGO tournament data publication—no decklists, no win rates, no curated statistics. Competitive players are preparing blind for upcoming RCQs.

item.title: Leonardo Cracks the Meta: TMNT Preview Season Kicks Off After Leak
item.description: Someone leaked TMNT cards early, so Wizards launched full preview season right after. Arena drops March 5 with release events, tabletop prerelease fires February 21-23, and the $49.99 bundles mirror Ravnica Remastered pricing.

item.title: Sheoldred's Arena Dream: First Limited Championship Qualifier Announced
item.description: Wizards just announced the first-ever MTG Arena Limited Championship Qualifier—limited grinders now have a direct path to the 2027 Magic Limited Championship. Plus, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles preorders are live.

item.title: Lutri Spikes to $72 and Gilt-Leaf Palace Surges: February Hot/Cold List
item.description: Lutri, the Spellchaser hits $72 after Commander unban, Gilt-Leaf Palace explodes to $18, and Torpor Orb becomes the most sideboarded card in Standard. Deceit cools as market corrects.

item.title: Biorhythm Is Back: February 2026's Massive B&R Update Shakes Everything
item.description: Feb 2026's massive B&R update: Biorhythm unbanned in Commander, Historic overhauled, Necropotence restricted. Plus: TMNT delays, Arena Challenge Lobbies, Magic Pride's partner format.

item.title: Gilded Lotus Returns: Magic Pride 2026 Rocks 'Every Commander Has Partner'
item.description: Magic Pride 2026 brings a revolutionary Commander format where any two commanders can partner. The Gilded Lotus promo is stunning. Here's how to get your store registered before March 27.

item.title: Spell Snare and the End of Friend Challenges: Arena's Big Update
item.description: MTG Arena just fixed social play with Challenge Lobbies, dropped TMNT preorder bundles, and set up Arena Championship 11. Spell Snare is getting depth art and these changes are actually huge.

item.title: Hasbro's 30th Anniversary Set Fiasco: Black Lotus and the Price of Scarcity
item.description: Hasbro faces a shareholder lawsuit over its management of the Magic 30th Anniversary set. The legal challenge could force Wizards to re-evaluate scarcity strategies. Here's what this means for players and the future of Magic.

item.title: Heroes in a Half Shell: TMNT Previews Kick Off February 17
item.description: Wizards confirmed TMNT previews start February 17 with live streams on Weekly MTG. The full set drops March 6, preorders are live now. Get ready for Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael, Michelangelo, and Splinter. This crossover is about to hit the table.

item.title: Companion App Update: Player Profiles Are a Lightning Bolt for Players
item.description: Wizards just announced Player Profiles for the Companion app, and it's the organized play tracking feature we've been begging for. Finally, you'll be able to see your event history, favorite local stores, and get a personalized inbox. This is a huge win for players who actually go to FNM.

item.title: Murktide Regent: Mastering Tempo in Modern Murktide
item.description: Most Modern players think they know Murktide Regent, but they're sequencing wrong. The secret? Tempo isn't about casting spells; it's about knowing when to hold 'em. Let's crack this Izzet puzzle open.

item.title: Bloodletter of Aclazotz Shines in Roll for Initiative Secret Lair
item.description: Wizards of the Coast is releasing the 'Roll for Initiative' Secret Lair Superdrop on February 9, featuring seven D&D-themed reprints. The standout card is Bloodletter of Aclazotz, a $30 vampire demon that doubles life loss during your turn. We break down the value and whether these drops are worth buying.

item.title: Lightning Bolt Survives Another Day: Pro Tour Shakeups, Sheoldred's Reign, and Counterspell's Comeback
item.description: The Pro Tour is over, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse is still breaking games, and Counterspell is back in force. Wizards announced a Timeless tournament that lets all three cards run wild. Here's your news roundup.

item.title: Remembering Kai Budde: The German Juggernaut's Legendary Legacy
item.description: The Magic community mourns the loss of Kai Budde, a five-time Pro Tour champion and four-time Player of the Year. His unmatched accomplishments and humble spirit left an indelible mark on the game.

item.title: Teferi, Hero of Dominaria Is Dominating: Your Azorius Control Standard Guide
item.description: Azorius Control is the deck to beat in Standard right now. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Supreme Verdict form the backbone of a strategy that makes aggro players cry.

item.title: Prophet of Kruphix Spikes 428%: Commander 'Stock Market' Goes Wild
item.description: Prophet of Kruphix gained 428% in two days while still banned. Sylvan Primordial jumped 353% and Golos 302% as speculators bet on the February 9 banlist announcement. The hybrid mana rule change might be the biggest story yet.

item.title: Orcish Bowmasters Is Just the Beginning: Five Cards Shaking Up Modern
item.description: Modern is getting wrecked by new printings and Orcish Bowmasters is leading the charge. Here are five cards that are already warping decklists and killing archetypes.

item.title: Grafdigger Cage Beats Standard's Best Deck
item.description: The top deck in Standard is crushing dreams, but Grafdigger Cage might be your secret weapon. Learn how to flip bad matchups and dominate the meta with these five cards.

item.title: Lotus Field Domination: Jeskai Combo in Vintage
item.description: Tapping for 12 mana on turn 4? That's the Jeskai Lotus Combo dream. With Lotus Field, Thespian Stage, and Blood Sun, you'll generate infinite mana and close the game with Omniscience. Pore Over the Pages draws you the cards you need to go off.

item.title: Nykthos Shrine to Nyx is Coming to MTG Arena - Pioneer Masters Announcement
item.description: Arena is finally getting Pioneer! Wizards just announced a curated Pioneer set with Nykthos Shrine to Nyx and Collected Company among the reprints. Modern players are already salivating.
